canoe1.description:
First order of business? Rent a canoe for the week.

Nana talks to Tom and Arianna, the people from whom we're renting the house.
canoe1.title: Canoe 1

canoe2.description: The boat saw more action on land than water. Here, Felix practices his crabbing technique while Milo get sets to row (he loved rowing while we sang 'Row Row Row Your Boat').
canoe2.title: Canoe 2

canoe3.description:
The coolest thing we saw from the canoe were big friggin' flappin' stingrays, on several occasions. They flew around lazily just under the surface, and sometimes their wingtips would breech. Thanks to the marvels of the internet, we now know they are cownose rays, they don't use their stingers on people often (except that one did nearly kill the very famous James Smith, the founder of the first permanent English colony in the New World).

Shown: Francoise, Felix and Lucie shove off. Noone fell victim to the terrible sting of the cownose ray.
canoe3.title: Canoe 3

cooking.description: Francoise and Felix bonded over cooking this vacation. Milo tried to keep up, but he just couldn't swing with the big dawgs.
cooking.title: Cooking

crab1.description: No Chesapeake vacation is complete without crabbing. Our little stretch of water, Long Haul Creek, is chockablock with the pinchy little things.
crab1.title: Crab 1

crab2.description: Three crabs at a time! And a good cook in the house. So sorry, crabbies.
crab2.title: Crab 2

crab3.description: Another day, another haul. Dean attempts to shake the last crab out but it must have gotten wind of what was in store: it held on for dear crabby life. Finally we tricked it by dipping the cage in the water.
crab3.title: Crab 3

crab4.description: This type of trap is called a hand trap. As we learned, they don't actually trap any crabs. At least, not for us.
crab4.title: Crab 4

crab6.description: Nana demonstrates the proper crab handling technique. Noone else was quite up to trying.
crab6.title: Crab 6

crab7.description: Milo loves every part of the crab catching, hammering and eating experience.
crab7.title: Crab 7

crab8.description: Felix finds a good way to practice his hand trap experience. He had just as much luck there as the ones at the dock.
crab8.title: Crab 8

ferry1.description: Day trip to Oxford, another little town on the bay. Rule #47 of a Chesapeake Bay vacation: never take a road when a ferry will do.
ferry1.title: Ferry 1

ferry2.description: We stayed behind the red line.
ferry2.title: Ferry 2

ferry3.description: We went to Oxford in search of a sandy beach. This 10 foot stretch was it. It was beautiful, except for the 100° weather and the BILLIONS of poisonous jellyfish that were actually washing up on shore.
ferry3.title: Ferry 3

hug.description: While vegging out before bed, Milo wrapped his arm around Felix. We don't know if it's Milo getting older or the lack of other kids to play with, but they've been super fantastic with each other this week. Pretty much the only bickering has been a legitimate and totally understandable difference in taste between Iron Giant and Sesame Street.
hug.title: Hug

nana.description:
Milo's really into the alphabet. His favorite letter is "W", but he can recognize a few others as well.

As soon as Nana suggests reading a book he shouts "ABCs!" and races off to find one of the many alphabet books around the house.
nana.title: Nana

sprinkler1.description: Felix discovered the joys of sprinklers. We just don't get enough hot days in Berkeley to do it.
sprinkler1.title: Sprinkler 1

sprinkler2.description: Like a gazelle streaker, he is.
sprinkler2.title: Sprinkler 2

sprinkler4.description: Dean gets in on the fun.
sprinkler4.title: Sprinkler 4

taxi01.description: It's a bird, it's a plane, it's a... Nana in a water taxi, headed to pick the rest of us up.
taxi01.title: Taxi 1

taxi02.description: Nana's friend Joyce came out for a day.
taxi02.title: Taxi 2

taxi03.description: Joyce lives in Baltimore, a very easy drive from St. Michaels.
taxi03.title: Taxi 3

taxi04.description: It was so hot that Milo drank all the water taxi captain's water. The captain seemed to be touched that a two year old bogarted all his drink. He was a nice guy.
taxi04.title: Taxi 4

tilghman.description: Near St. Michaels is Tilghman Island. On a busy day the drawbridge is more up than down.
tilghman.title: Tilghman

tilghman1.description: On Tilghman island we took a boat tour that showed us all about the fishing and crabbing industry. But first they introduced us to the primitive-looking horseshoe crabs in their tank. We actually saw a lot of horseshoe crab shells from the canoe -- they molt, just like snakes.
tilghman1.title: Tilghman 1

tilghman2.description: We had the boat to ourselves.
tilghman2.title: Tilghman 2

tilghman3.description: We found that boats NEVER wait for that drawbridge. The drawkeeper (that's the real word for the guy) just doesn't like cars or something.
tilghman3.title: Tilghman 3

tilghman4.description: Milo, happy as one of the many bottom dwelling crustaceans harvested in the bay.
tilghman4.title: Tilghman 4

tilghman5.description: He only tried to jump overboard once or twice.
tilghman5.title: Tilghman 5

tilghman6.description: Lucie was very well behaved. She didn't try to jump overboard at all.
tilghman6.title: Tilghman 6

undertow.description: Day trip to the Atlantic. A town called Bethany Beach. It was still scorching hot but 1) they rented umbrellas, and 2) the waters were blissfully jellyfish-free.
undertow.title: Undertow

weather.description: On Saturday, the last day, the temperature dropped 10 degrees. Wow, what a difference! Suddenly it was nice enough to eat, walk and play outside. We had a great time just enjoying life.
weather.title: Weather

description:
We generally don't write about the weather, but it's been a major presence on this vacation. It's been 200 degrees every single day. Well, okay, 95 to 100°F before you factor in the 90% humidity.

To cook the crabs we just take them out of the trap and leave them on the dock for a few minutes.

Finally, on the last day, the temperature dropped 10 degrees and it we found ourselves having a perfect Chesapeake Bay summer day. Just wish we had more of them!
title: August 6
